channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown tree branches blocking cycle lane, 16th February
item.description:
Similar issues reported before - cycle lane is blocked and need to cycle on the other side to avoid cycling into branches

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trafalgar Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple holes in road, 16th February
item.description:
Multiple pot holes in road on Leesons way and on petersham Drive. These are getting bigger. They need filling asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countless large, severe, sharp-edged, dangerous potholes, 16th February
item.description:
This whole stretch of road needs to be completely resurfaced. There are countless potholes, the majority of which are unavoidable and very sharp-edged, which are highly likely to cause severe damage to vehicles. I’m tired of reporting road defects in this area one-by-one as there are too many to count, let alone report individually. All repairs carried out in recent months have already failed, and the surface is either sinking again or new pot holes have already formed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole has developed next to the cycle lane, outside 228 Lower Road, 16th February
item.description:
This pothole is getting larger and the road surface around it is crumbling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: More fly tipping, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wild's Rents, Walworth, Greater London

item.title: Parking on pavement, 16th February
item.description:
Parking on the pavement on both sides of Gayton Road (a no parking zone) is a hazard to pedestrians and is causing damage to the pavement. Enforcement is needed, especially in the morning and evening peak travel times. The concrete blocks have been moved on the north side of Gayton Road. These did provide some protection.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gayton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large and deep pothole, 16th February
item.description:
The road has a dangerous pothole that almost caused an accident when I was driving at night as it can't be seen in the dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, Little Ilford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian island keep left sign lights bulbs out x 3 different center islands, 16th February
item.description:
Along the length of Welling Way there are 3 separate central pedestrian islands in the middle of the roadway that do not have lighting of the "KEEP LEFT" arrows lit. Makes the central islands hard to see at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Welling Way, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just outside 42 Priory Park Road, 16th February
item.description:
Someone has emptied some rubbish bags here. What are you doing to address this? It is happening in this area every day. Why can't you put some cameras up?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 16th February
item.description:
This bike has been chained here for at least two years. I have reported it twice before here but nothing has been done. The bike’s basket / container is now being used as a de facto rubbish bin. (See photos)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
